meanings.definition: Of, relating to, or characteristic of the countryside.
meanings.sent1: The rural landscape was filled with green fields and peaceful farms.
meanings.sent2: She preferred the rural life over the hustle and bustle of the city.
meanings.sent3: The rural chickens had a gossip session by the old oak tree.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a rural paradise, untouched by the chaos of urban living.
meanings.sent5: The smell of fresh hay in the rural air was a comforting embrace.

meanings.sent1: The rural villagers gathered at the town square for the annual festival.
meanings.sent2: Deer and rabbits are common sights in rural areas.
meanings.sent3: The rural cows had a dance party under the starry sky.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was a rural soul, connected to the earth and its rhythms.
meanings.sent5: The sound of crickets chirping filled the rural night with music.

meanings.definition: A person living in a rural area.
meanings.sent1: The rural was known for his kindness and generosity towards neighbors.
meanings.sent2: Many families in the rural work on farms or in small businesses.
meanings.sent3: The rural decided to start a community garden to bring people together.
meanings.sent4: She was a rural at heart, finding solace in the simplicity of country life.
meanings.sent5: The old rural shared stories of the past with the young children in the village.
